Entries.default:
"You there, approaching!" 

The guard sneers, fat lips peeling back from his yellowed teeth. He grunts. Muscles flex and pop in his thickset neck as he cranes for a better look at you.
"Then hurry and let me through."
"What auction?"

"If anyone is to hurry, it should be you. I grow tired of opening and closing the gate."

His chest heaves as he cranks the winch to raise the heavy grating.
"Know you where you are? This is Crookspur."
"Crookspur?"
"I'd like to join the bidding if there's still time."
"I'd like to speak with the person who runs this operation."
"Think it's up to me, who sees the master? No, that decision is made by the auctioneer."
"This place. This is the apex of the slave trade."
"Run, ogre. Run and tell your master that I've come for his head."

"The day I run from a kith is the day that - ! There will never be a day!" 

A growl rips from his throat. He swings his cannon madly, bellowing a command to have the drawbridge raised.
"Ah, yes. The auction. That's why I'm here."
"You are late. The auction is almost over."

"What other could it be? The weekly auction. For the whimpering chattel."

He rolls his heavy head on his neck, joints popping audibly with each rotation.
"Either you've come to buy slaves. Or the master has no time for you."
"Despicable swine, I'll slaughter you all."
"Take care that I do not drop it as you walk beneath."

"Enter for the auction. Or do not enter."

He grunts and hulks his shoulders.
"How much blood can you spill, kith? How much flesh can you cleave from bone when you are there - and we are safe?"

"None, I think." 

A growl rips from his throat. He hefts his weapon madly, bellowing a command to have the drawbridge raised.
[Attack without warning.]
[Say nothing.]
"I have no patience for mutes and dullards."
